result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas D. Macier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No violent contact with victim.
-----------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
-----------------------------

timeConds.notes: Complete forty (40) hours of community service work during the period of probation ordered WITH buyout option.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas D. Macier

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Nicholas D. Macier in court with attorney David A Danz.  Matthew W. Surridge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

Defendant Nicholas D. Macier in court with attorney David A Danz.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond remains. Motion deadline 05-02-16. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH G.S.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Nicholas D. Macier appeared with attorney David Danz, Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
